intro: Lamottea calva, commonly known as the woolly bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or alpine settings. Lamottea calva is also noted for its hardiness and ability to withstand colder temperatures.
